jmf.discovery.implementation

Class PeerDiscoveryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • jmf.discovery.implementation.PeerDiscoveryService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPeerDiscoveryService

    public class PeerDiscoveryService
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPeerDiscoveryService
    Service class to recognize other modules and there states in the network The PeerDiscoveryService Class regularly sends out udp-multicasts to the network and receives those of other module instances. In doing so it recognizes other modules with their current lifecycleState and adds them to the PeerRegistryClass, where all known module instances are listed and updated. At the same time the service lets all other instances know of the current state of its own module so that they can update their registries in the same way. The PeerDiscoveryService is a main component of the ZMF-framework and thus started and stopped with the ZMF-instance. Created 8/1/15
    Author:
    Matthias Blohm, Jonas Grunert

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public boolean start(IPeerDiscoveryCore core,
                     ModuleHandleInternal selfHandle,
                     int broadcastFrequency,
                     short udpPort,
                     boolean peerDiscoveryWait,
                     boolean disableEqualModuleInterconnect)
        Starts the peer discovery service: State multicasting, peer discovery and module registry
        Specified by:
        start in interface IPeerDiscoveryService
        Parameters:
        core - Reference to the ZMF core
        selfHandle - Module handle for the module of this instance. Contains information about module and its state
        broadcastFrequency - Frequency to send out state multicasts (in milliseconds between multicasts)
        udpPort - UDP port for state multicast communication
        peerDiscoveryWait - If true the service will wait until all active modules discovered before it returns from the starting process
        disableEqualModuleInterconnect -
        Returns:
        Returns true if start successful, false otherwise
